Package seng202.team3.model

Class DataFilter

java.lang.Object
seng202.team3.model.DataFilter
public class DataFilter extends Object
Main filtering class. Filters specific attributes (such as PoliceData or UserData records, whether an arrest was made, etc.) and also sorts depending on whether region search is active (according to low/high frequency, high/low risk areas)

  • Method Details

    • filterData

      public ArrayList<CrimeData> filterData​(ArrayList<CrimeData> data)
      Returns a list of crime data after filtering has been processed with ALL the active filters.
      Parameters:
      data - List of crime data to be filtered.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of CrimeData containing only filtered data

    • isWithinRange

      public boolean isWithinRange​(Date startDate, Date endDate, Date testDate)
      Checks whether a date is within range of the startDate and endDate given.
      Parameters:
      startDate - selected by the user and processed in UIDataInterface
      endDate - selected by the user and processed in UIDataInterface
      testDate - date of a given CrimeData object.
      Returns:
      true if within range, false if not.

    • filterCrimeData

      public ArrayList<CrimeData> filterCrimeData​(CrimeStat filter, ArrayList<CrimeData> data, ArrayList<CrimeStat> activeFilters)
      Filters a list of CrimeData according to a single specific given filter.
      Parameters:
      filter - criteria used to filter data.
      data - list of CrimeData objects to be filtered.
      activeFilters - list of the active filters on the data.
      Returns:
      an Arraylist of CrimeData with filtered crimes.

    • sortOverrider

      public ArrayList<CrimeData> sortOverrider​(HashMap<String,​ArrayList<CrimeData>> countList)
      Overrides the sorting criteria by comparing the lengths of ArrayLists in the given HashMap.
      Parameters:
      countList - a Hashmap which maps a given attribute (crime_type or ward) to an ArrayList of CrimeData associated with this.
      Returns:
      a final sorted ArrayList, in ascending order.

    • sortByRisk

      public ArrayList<CrimeData> sortByRisk​(ArrayList<CrimeData> filteredData)
      Sorts the CrimeData objects array according to whether they belong to the ward with the highest number of crimes.
      Parameters:
      filteredData - An ArrayList of CrimeData which has already been filtered/checked against other filters.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of CrimeData in ascending order, according to which ward has the highest number of crimes.

    • sortByFrequency

      public ArrayList<CrimeData> sortByFrequency​(ArrayList<CrimeData> crimeDataArrayList, boolean isLowFrequency)
      Method which returns a sorted arraylist of crimes based on high frequency or low frequency.
      Parameters:
      crimeDataArrayList - The crimes required to sort.
      isLowFrequency - Whether we want to sort in ascending or descending order.
      Returns:
      A sorted arraylist of crimeData.

    • crimeInRange

      public boolean crimeInRange​(String crimeAddress, Double[] inputLatLong)
      Calculates whether two address' are within 1 km radius of each other
      Parameters:
      crimeAddress - Address of a CrimeDataObject
      inputLatLong - Address of user input
      Returns:
      True if address' are within 1 km radius, false otherwise
